24.text: Breakaway Resources Ltd entered into a farm in and joint venture agreement over the

25.text: Mount  Finnerty  project  with  tenement  holder  Barranco  Resources  NL  30th  August

26.text: 2006. This report describes the exploration activities carried out tenement by Barranco

27.text: and Breakaway during the reporting period 1 November 2005 to 31 October 2006.

text:
Breakaway Resources Ltd entered into a farm in and joint venture agreement over the 
 Mount  Finnerty  project  with  tenement  holder  Barranco  Resources  NL  30th  August 
 2006. This report describes the exploration activities carried out tenement by Barranco 
 and Breakaway during the reporting period 1 November 2005 to 31 October 2006.

31.text: hills.  The  sequence  is  flanked  to  the  west  by  granite.  Outcrop  is  generally  poor

32.text: except for the thickened portion of the ultramafic sequence in the central tenement

33.text: area  where  silica-cap  lithologies  after  ultramafic  units  are  exposed  as  low  hills  and

34.text: ridges. In this area cumulate textured dunite and peridotite units grade eastward into

35.text: tremolite-chlorite-amphibole rocks, dolerite and basalt. Much of the remaining area is

36.text: covered  by  laterite,  lateritic  gravels  and  soils,  red  colluvial  soil,  and  aeolian  sandy

37.text: soils  derived  from  granite.  GSWA  outcrop  geology  is  shown  on  Figure  3.

text:
hills.  The  sequence  is  flanked  to  the  west  by  granite.  Outcrop  is  generally  poor 
 except for the thickened portion of the ultramafic sequence in the central tenement 
 area  where  silica-cap  lithologies  after  ultramafic  units  are  exposed  as  low  hills  and 
 ridges. In this area cumulate textured dunite and peridotite units grade eastward into 
 tremolite-chlorite-amphibole rocks, dolerite and basalt. Much of the remaining area is 
 covered  by  laterite,  lateritic  gravels  and  soils,  red  colluvial  soil,  and  aeolian  sandy 
 soils  derived  from  granite.  GSWA  outcrop  geology  is  shown  on  Figure  3.

29.text: dolerite  and  basalt  and  into  felsic  volcanic  and  sedimentary  units  to  the  east.  The

43.text: Sporadic  gold  exploration  was  carried  out  on  the  tenement  between  mid  1980  and

44.text: 1987. Companies exploring for gold in the Hunt Range greenstone belt at this time

45.text: were  BP  Minerals  Ltd,  Aberfoyle  Resources  Ltd,  Forrestania  Gold  NL  and  Cyprus

46.text: Mining  Limited.  A  number  of  gold  prospects  were  identified  through  soil  and  RAB

47.text: drilling  geochemistry.  However,  only  the  Mt  Dimer  deposits,  30  kilometres  to  the

48.text: northwest  of  Exploration  Licence  Application  16/305,  proved  to  be  of  sufficient

49.text: tonnage  and  grade  to  develop  a  mining  operation.  No  substantial  gold  anomalism

55.text: A summary of the exploration work completed on the Mount Finnerty Project during

56.text: 2006 together with the prospect locations is included as an index plan (Figure 1).

text:
Sporadic  gold  exploration  was  carried  out  on  the  tenement  between  mid  1980  and 
 1987. Companies exploring for gold in the Hunt Range greenstone belt at this time 
 were  BP  Minerals  Ltd,  Aberfoyle  Resources  Ltd,  Forrestania  Gold  NL  and  Cyprus 
 Mining  Limited.  A  number  of  gold  prospects  were  identified  through  soil  and  RAB 
 drilling  geochemistry.  However,  only  the  Mt  Dimer  deposits,  30  kilometres  to  the 
 northwest  of  Exploration  Licence  Application  16/305,  proved  to  be  of  sufficient 
 tonnage  and  grade  to  develop  a  mining  operation.  No  substantial  gold  anomalism 
   EXPLORATION BY BREAKAWAY RESOURCES LTD

 2006 together with the prospect locations is included as an index plan (Figure 1).

37.text: A single RC drill hole (MF103) tested the above anomaly to a depth of 122 metres.

38.text: Several  komatiite,  talc  schist  and  peridotite-dunite  sequences  were  encountered

39.text: before the hole terminated in felsic rocks. At 87 metres, fresh dunite was intersected,

text:
Between  1993-1997  Arimco  carried  out  gold  and  nickel  exploration,  confirming 
 results  obtained  by  WMC.  Rock  chip  sampling  at  two  locations  returned  values  of 
 1.19%  Ni  and  600  ppm  Cu  from  boxwork  textured  gossanous  outcrop.  Three  RAB 
 drill holes tested this area and defined a 15 metre thick zone of anomalous nickel and 
 copper in serpentinite talc schist. The best values returned from this drilling were 4 
 metres at 0.77% Ni and 1000ppm Cu.  
 A single RC drill hole (MF103) tested the above anomaly to a depth of 122 metres. 
 Several  komatiite,  talc  schist  and  peridotite-dunite  sequences  were  encountered 
 before the hole terminated in felsic rocks. At 87 metres, fresh dunite was intersected, 
 which contained fine-grained nickel sulphides (pentlandite). Arimco did not follow up

83.text: A six kilometre AMG-based local grid baseline was established by Spectrum Surveys

84.text: of Kalgoorlie using the old cleared WMC baseline. A datum point of 7000E (baseline)

85.text: and 20,000N was selected at the point where AMG Zone 51 6607000N crosses the

86.text: baseline. Local grid cross-lines will be established from the baseline as required.
